entry.title: ikejirirb @ Google Telework Lounge
entry.content:
ikejirirb is a study group that consists of two ruby programmer @katorie and @risacan. We meet once a week to study programming. We have been making a gem for Ruboty (Hubot in Ruby basically) this month.

We decided to meet at Google Telework Lounge that opens for 1 month to promote telework. Itâ€™s free for charge including Wifi ğŸ”Š and electricity ğŸ”Œ but not ğŸš½ (you have to go out of the place and go downstairs to ). There werenâ€™t so crowded but booth area was occupied by business people. So we sat at a big table in an opened area.

We tried pair programming, which is a programing technique that two programmers work together in one computer. ğŸ‘© ğŸ‘© ğŸ’» The result was brilliant. We were concentrated on programming (not chatting), gave feedbacks, shared the knowledge and found potential bugs before starting the program. Plus, we didnâ€™t stop coding to think that much. We just started the program to see the result. That might sound quite normal to veterans but the point is that the cycle of fixing code was so much faster than when I do it alone. We had a huge progress!


See the smile

END

  • Export as WebGL
  • Upload to unityroom which is a website to share unity-made games with webGL
  • And tada !

Things I learned.

My first #unity1week is over! There are many things to brush up but sometimes done is better than perfect. Here are the things I learned from #unity1week.

  • Make START/RETRY/RESULT functions first.
    • I made Start/Retry/Result feature on Sunday (the last day of unity1week). I wish I made these first because it is a basic feature for all games and I can reuse them as a template for other games.
  • Make all function on the first day to leave time for level designing.
    • I set the goal to make a game in 1 WEEK. So I spreaded the tasks over a week and that was a big mistake, because I didnâ€™t have time for level desigining! Level design is one of the most important thing in game creation. Even if the visual is not fancy, it can be fun to play when the level design is right. I really want to focus on it next time so that the player can be entertained.
  • Play more games
    • There are tons of games on unityroom. I should have played more games to get inspired!

Definitely gonna do it next time!

Overall, I had a lot of fun! Itâ€™s fun to create and to see other games. The theme â€œSpaceâ€ was abstract this time so people interpreted in various ways! Check them out here Unity 1é€±é–“ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚¸ãƒ£ãƒ  | ç„¡æ–™ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ æŠ•ç¨¿ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆ unityroom - Unityã®ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ã‚’ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã—ã¦å…¬é–‹ã—ã‚ˆã†

END

entry.title: unity1week Day4
entry.content:
What I did

  • Change the color of the target rectangle.
  • Draw some dogs.
  • Replace rectangles to those images.

I was thinking about adding START/FINISH feature but decided to add images to keep myself motivated. And it worked! HOW CUTE THEY ARE! I forgot to draw spacesuits for the dog at the window ( which is my first original character in childhood ) but I donâ€™t care. Itâ€™s cute.

Drawing tools

  • &
  • Scannable | Evernote
  • Preview on Mac

I just drew dogs on paper with Muji pen, scanned with Scannable, sent the image to Mac, edited with Preview and dragged the image into Unity.

entry.title: unity1week Day2
entry.content:
What is unity1week ?

Unity 1 week is an one-week game jam. The theme comes out at Monday and you finish creating at Sunday at 20:00. Upload the game on the web with WebGL.

Space

â€œSpaceâ€ is the theme for 11/13 ~ 11/19.

My Idea

This is my first time to join Unity 1 week so I decided to start with something I am familiar with, which is 2D.
